Subject: Jabil Inc. (JBL)
Key Findings: Jabil Inc. is undergoing a clear strategic pivot, divesting its Mobility business while aggressively investing in the high-growth AI and Data Center sector. Recent acquisitions (Hanley Energy Group, Mikros Technologies) and product launches (J-422G Servers, Silicon Photonics expansion) demonstrate a strong commitment to becoming a key player in AI infrastructure, particularly in power management and liquid cooling solutions. This focus on advanced technology and high-value segments contrasts with the divestiture of its traditional Mobility business.

Subject: Celestica Inc. (CLS)
Key Findings: Celestica Inc. (CLS) is undergoing a significant transformation, with its growth focus clearly shifting towards the Connectivity and Cloud Solutions (CCS) division, particularly in AI and data center infrastructure. The company is actively launching products such as the SD6300 ultra-high-density storage system to meet the demands of hyperscale customers for AI and machine learning workloads. This strategic shift has driven a substantial increase in its stock price in 2025, with analysts considering its engineering capabilities and core position within the AI data center ecosystem as a strong “moat.”

Subject: Benchmark Electronics Inc. (BHE)
Key Findings: Benchmark Electronics' strategic focus clearly leans towards high-value, high-complexity manufacturing operations and global capacity expansion. Between 2023 and 2025, the company undertook multiple factory expansions and new facility openings, indicating substantial capital expenditures aimed at supporting its high-value customer base. Its investments and collaborations in areas such as semiconductors and photonics packaging demonstrate an active commitment to emerging high-tech sectors, with its core business transitioning from traditional electronic manufacturing services to more specialized, high-value manufacturing solutions.

Subject: Sanmina Corporation (SANM)
Key Findings: Sanmina Corporation has demonstrated a clear strategic focus and investment in data center infrastructure and energy businesses. In 2025, the company significantly strengthened its presence in the AI/data center sector through the acquisition of ZT Systems' data center infrastructure manufacturing business. Additionally, the company announced an expansion of its energy business facility in Houston, reflecting continued CapEx commitment to support its high-growth vertical markets.

Subject: Flex Ltd. (FLEX)
Key Findings: Flex Ltd. is actively shifting its business focus towards high-value, high-growth sectors, particularly data centers and artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure. Leveraging its "Advanced Manufacturing" capabilities, the company concentrates on providing complex manufacturing and supply chain solutions for AI and data center clients, including announcements related to liquid cooling technology prominently featured on its investor relations site. While Flex continues to support its traditional businesses, its strategy and capital expenditure allocation clearly favor technology-intensive, high-end manufacturing areas to capitalize on the growth in AI-driven hardware demand.
